meta.name: description
meta.content: Phalen Leadership Academies is a non-profit turnaround school operator with a network of high-quality tuition-free public and charter schools across the country.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Phalen Leadership Academies, PLA, Earl Martin Phalen, George and Veronica Phalen Leadership Academies, School Turnaround, School Improvement, Improving Test Scores, Improving Student performance, Educ
Phalen Leadership Academies is a non-profit turnaround school operator with a network of high-quality tuition-free public and charter schools across the country.

div.p: A Transformative Leader in School Turnaround

img.alt: Thank You PLA Teachers!

div.p: Our teachers are at the heart of all that we do. We would like to say thank you for your dedication to our schools and scholars!

a.title: Go to comments for Thank You PLA Teachers!

img.alt: 90% of the world's students are in lockdown. It's going to hit poor kids much harder than rich ones

a.span: 90% of the world's students are in lockdown. It's going to hit poor kids much harder than rich ones

div.p: PLA Featured in CNN News

a.title: Go to comments for 90% of the world's students are in lockdown. It's going to hit poor kids much harder than rich ones

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies

a.span: PLA CEO Featured in Virtual Town Hall Meeting on Educational Changes Amid Covid-19

div.p: Watch PLA CEO & Founder, Earl Martin Phalen, in this special virtual town hall meeting as he discusses how to help Indy families adapt to educational changes amid the COVID-19 crisis. Don't miss this exciting panel put on by the Indianapolis Recorder with some of Indy's top leaders in education.

a.title: Go to comments for PLA CEO Featured in Virtual Town Hall Meeting on Educational Changes Amid Covid-19

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies

a.span: Schools Adapting to COV-19: Phalen Academies to Launch E-Learning Platforms at Its 22 Schools Across the Country

div.p: Despite the challenges the COVID-19 pandemic has posed, we are determined to continue to meet the unique needs of each scholar in each of our schools. Support our scholars as they strive to maintain learning gains.

a.title: Go to comments for Schools Adapting to COV-19: Phalen Academies to Launch E-Learning Platforms at Its 22 Schools Across the Country

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies

a.span: POSTPONED: Arts & Culture Center Ribbon Cutting Postponed Until Further Notice

div.p: In light of the national health crisis that we are facing, we are postponing the ribbon cutting ceremony to a later date. We will release an announcement when a new date has been identified. Thank you for your interest in supporting the development of this project and much needed resource for our community. We look forward to the opportunity to celebrate with you in the near future!

a.title: Go to comments for POSTPONED: Arts & Culture Center Ribbon Cutting Postponed Until Further Notice

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies Texas

a.span: PLA Announces Texas Hiring Event and Open House

div.p: Parents, scholars, and families in Texas are invited to Experience the PLA Difference on Saturday, February 29th at 10am.

a.title: Go to comments for PLA Announces Texas Hiring Event and Open House

img.alt: Teach at Phalen Leadership Academies

a.span: Phalen Leadership Academies Announce National Hiring Recruitment Efforts

div.p: We're Hiring! View available positions and apply today! Here's your opportunity to make a difference in the lives of children!

a.title: Go to comments for Phalen Leadership Academies Announce National Hiring Recruitment Efforts

img.alt: Earl Martin Phalen

a.span: PLA CEO Named Re-Envisioning Foster Care in American (REFCA) Champion

div.p: Largest African-American School Turnaround Operator NamedRe-Envisioning Foster Care in America (REFCA) Champion

a.title: Go to comments for PLA CEO Named Re-Envisioning Foster Care in American (REFCA) Champion

img.alt: Washington Informer Feature: Talent First: How the Phalen Leadership Academies Closed Achievement Gaps Through Effective Teaching

a.span: Washington Informer Feature: Talent First: How the Phalen Leadership Academies Closed Achievement Gaps Through Effective Teaching

div.p: Six years ago, Earl Martin Phalen founded what has quickly become the largest African American-run charter school network in the country.

a.title: Go to comments for Washington Informer Feature: Talent First: How the Phalen Leadership Academies Closed Achievement Gaps Through Effective Teaching

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies

a.span: PLA Honing in on Strengthening Partner School Climate and Culture

div.p: The goal is to provide a safe and supportive school climate by creating consistency across all PLA schools and meeting the unique needs of students at varying levels of behavioral and social/emotional development.

a.title: Go to comments for PLA Honing in on Strengthening Partner School Climate and Culture

img.alt: PLA: Reinventing America's Schools

div.p: Phalen Leadership Academies featured for blazing new trails in the book "Reinventing America's Schools ."

a.title: Go to comments for PLA: Reinventing America's Schools

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies

a.span: PLA Scholars are Back for the 2019-2020 School Year!

div.p: PLA schools across the country are officially back in session. Welcome back to our amazing teachers and our extraordinary scholars. We missed you! Let's get ready for an incredible school year!

a.title: Go to comments for PLA Scholars are Back for the 2019-2020 School Year!

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies

a.span: College and Career Readiness for Students on Indys Far Eastside Phalen Leadership Academies Awarded $125K Glick Fund Grant

div.p: PLA has been awarded a $125K grant from Glick Fund to build a college and career readiness program aiding scholars in one of the citys most underserved communities.

a.title: Go to comments for College and Career Readiness for Students on Indys Far Eastside Phalen Leadership Academies Awarded $125K Glick Fund Grant

img.alt: Jones-Clark and Smith Middle School Gain New Resources Under Phalen Leadership Academies

a.span: Jones-Clark and Smith Middle School Gain New Resources Under Phalen Leadership Academies

div.p: With the help of Phalen Leadership Academies (PLA), Mae Jones-Clark Elementary School and Willie Ray Smith Middle School will receive an infusion of technology and resources that support teacher development, scholar learning and overall student growth.

a.title: Go to comments for Jones-Clark and Smith Middle School Gain New Resources Under Phalen Leadership Academies

img.alt: Its a New School Year and Jones-Clark Elementary and Smith Middle School Are On The Rise!

a.span: Its a New School Year and Jones-Clark Elementary and Smith Middle School Are On The Rise!

div.p: At PLAs core, we put children first, we show gratitude for our scholars, families and community, and we believe in having determination in making sure that our scholars and schools reach their goals. PLA, Smith Middle and Jones Clark Elementary are amazing partners; and we know that our scholars and families will be able to feel that this fall.

a.title: Go to comments for Its a New School Year and Jones-Clark Elementary and Smith Middle School Are On The Rise!

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies

a.span: PLA Talks Making a Difference in the Lives of Scholars on Indy's 1310 The Light

div.p: Phalen Leadership Academies Live on air at 1310 The Light with Tina Cosby

a.title: Go to comments for PLA Talks Making a Difference in the Lives of Scholars on Indy's 1310 The Light

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies

a.span: Phalen: We Need Bold Action to Transform Our Schools

div.p: This essay is part of a special series commemorating the 65th anniversary of the landmark Brown v. Board of Education school desegregation case.

a.title: Go to comments for Phalen: We Need Bold Action to Transform Our Schools

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academy

a.span: RTV 6 Feature: Changing Lives for Scholars on the Far Eastside

div.p: "You will never feel nothing like it," Eric Faden, an 8th grader at the school, said. "They care so much - it's unreal how much they care."

a.title: Go to comments for RTV 6 Feature: Changing Lives for Scholars on the Far Eastside

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies New Community Arts Center

a.span: Far east side church converting into new community arts center: This is going to transform their lives

div.p: Story by Melissa Crash, Fox 59

a.title: Go to comments for Far east side church converting into new community arts center: This is going to transform their lives

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies New Community Arts Center

a.span: Founder of Phalen Academies to Talk With Arts Leaders About New Arts Center

div.p: Thanks to a $3,045,350 grant from the Lilly Endowment Inc., Phalen Leadership Academies is transforming an old church into an arts center. On Thursday, April 4, 10 a.m., Earl Martin Phalen, the Founder & CEO of the school network will meet with local arts organizations and arts education advocates to solicit their feedback.

a.title: Go to comments for Founder of Phalen Academies to Talk With Arts Leaders About New Arts Center

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academy Joins the Beaumont Community

div.p: 'We believe our scholars have the ability to be the best.'

a.title: Go to comments for PLA Joins the Beaumont Community

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academy scholar in class

a.span: Phalen Leadership Academies Partners with Beaumont Schools to Ensure Scholar Success

div.p: We are excited to meet and support the scholars, parents and teachers at Jones Clark Elementary and Smith Middle, said PLA CEO and Founder Earl Martin Phalen.

a.title: Go to comments for Phalen Leadership Academies Partners with Beaumont Schools to Ensure Scholar Success

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies STEM Scholars featured on WISH-TV in Indianapolis, Indiana

a.span: PLA STEM Scholars Featured on WISH-TV

div.p: PLA serves 16 schools across the country with 4 A-Rated schools in Indianapolis

a.title: Go to comments for PLA STEM Scholars Featured on WISH-TV

img.alt: The Fight For Life Foundation founder Marlin Jackson

a.span: Fight For Life Foundation Works to Be A Blessing to PLA Families

div.p: Over 700 PLA scholars got toys for the holidays, enjoyed a pizza party, games, and activities from Jack and Jill Magazine.

a.title: Go to comments for Fight For Life Foundation Works to Be A Blessing to PLA Families

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies scholars working in class

a.span: PLA to Help Transform Community by Providing Beauty and Art on Indys Far Eastside

div.p: Phalen Leadership Academies (PLA) has received a grant of $3 million as part of Lilly Endowment Inc.s Strengthening Indianapolis Through Arts and Cultural Innovation initiative.

a.title: Go to comments for PLA to Help Transform Community by Providing Beauty and Art on Indys Far Eastside

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies Scholars participating in class

a.span: Grand Slam: All 4 PLA Indy Schools Now A-Rated

div.p: "Our scholars can and will continue to improve, but to note that all four of our Indy schools are A-rated is a grand slam. We are working to create a new narrative in school turnaround.

a.title: Go to comments for Grand Slam: All 4 PLA Indy Schools Now A-Rated

img.alt: Kaneshia Williams teaching students in class

a.span: Looking ahead: Tampa teacher plans fair to empower parents

div.p: Tampa Bay Teacher at PLA Partner School Working to Empower Parents

a.title: Go to comments for Looking ahead: Tampa teacher plans fair to empower parents

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies Trunk-or-Treat Event

a.span: Thank You! Hundreds of Indy Families Come Out for the PLA Trunk-or-Treat

div.p: On Tuesday, October 30, Phalen Leadership Academies hosted its first annual Trunk-or-Treat in partnership with the Indianapolis Metropolitan Police Department. Other community partners included The Indianapolis Public Library and Covering Kids & Families Indiana (Advocating Health Coverage for Central Indiana). The event welcomed over 700 people (an estimated 800 attendees with 700 confirmed) to George and Veronica Phalen Leadership Academies.

a.title: Go to comments for Thank You! Hundreds of Indy Families Come Out for the PLA Trunk-or-Treat

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies Turnk-or-Treat Poster

a.span: Join Phalen Leadership Academies and the IMPD at PLAs First Annual Trunk-or-Treat

div.p: The event will be held at George and Veronica Phalen Leadership Academy [2323 N. Illinois Street] from 5:30pm-7:30pm and is open to the public. PLA CEO and Founder Earl Martin Phalen encourages Phalen scholars, parents, and community to attend.

a.title: Go to comments for Join Phalen Leadership Academies and the IMPD at PLAs First Annual Trunk-or-Treat

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies working in class

a.span: PLA for the Win! Organization Delivers on its Promise as Scholars Outperform Local Schools

div.p: PLAs schools and scholars have been working to master and improve academic performance. This years ISTEP results show they did just that with all four PLA Indy schools outperforming local peers.

a.title: Go to comments for PLA for the Win! Organization Delivers on its Promise as Scholars Outperform Local Schools

a.span: PLA Pushes for Teacher and Scholar Success with the PLA Coaching Cycle

div.p: At Phalen Leadership Academies, we are really blessed with amazing teachers and scholars, said PLA Founder and CEO Earl Martin Phalen. If we want to continue to be our best, we have to consciously seek opportunities to grow and get better each day."

a.title: Go to comments for PLA Pushes for Teacher and Scholar Success with the PLA Coaching Cycle

a.span: Young Actors Theatre Joins Phalen Leadership Academies

div.p: The drama education program, also known as Self-Empowerment Theatre, is an award winner with National Youth Theatre Group and is one of the nations most progressive youth theatres.

a.title: Go to comments for Young Actors Theatre Joins Phalen Leadership Academies

div.p: "We really love our scholars..and we want to make sure that they are getting the education they deserve."

a.span: Merrillville School HIAT Joins the PLA Network

div.p: A new school is joining the Phalen Leadership Academy network. The Higher Institute of Arts and Technology (HIAT) located in Merrillville, Indiana is in the process of joining the PLA family.

a.title: Go to comments for Merrillville School HIAT Joins the PLA Network

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies scholar featured on Wish TV

a.span: PLA Scholar Featured on WISH TV

div.p: A 3rd grade scholar at Phalen Leadership Academies (PLA) has added a rare accolade to her nameauthor. Samiah Turner, who participates in PLAs STEMNASIUM partnership has released her debut autobiography My Life as an 8-Year Old Engineer.

a.title: Go to comments for PLA Scholar Featured on WISH TV

img.alt: Teacher helping a student with an assignment in class

a.span: Education Week Features Partnership between Indianapolis Public Schools and Phalen Leadership Academies

div.p: Creating District-Charter Alliances Meet Lewis Ferebee, 2016 Leader to Learn From

a.title: Go to comments for Education Week Features Partnership between Indianapolis Public Schools and Phalen Leadership Academies

img.alt: Teacher interacting with students in class

div.p: As the story goes, Phalen Leadership Academies (PLA) started as a summer program, expanded into innovative charter schools, and now, with the support of excellent staff, PLA has sparked partnerships with school districts across the country to improve the educational experiences of scholars. Now, PLAs next stop is Tampa, Florida.

a.title: Go to comments for PLA Expands to Tampa

img.alt: JRP scholars

a.span: All PLA-JRP 8th Graders Eligible for Full-Ride College Scholarships

div.p: All 8th grade scholars at James and Rosemary Phalen Leadership Academy (JRPLA) have been given a golden opportunity to have their college tuitions paid in full by Indianas 21st Century Scholars Programsaving parents and scholars up to $40,000 in college tuition.

a.title: Go to comments for All PLA-JRP 8th Graders Eligible for Full-Ride College Scholarships

img.alt: Student building a drone

a.span: Elementary Students Build Drones, Mobile Apps, and Excitement for STEM

a.title: Go to comments for Elementary Students Build Drones, Mobile Apps, and Excitement for STEM

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Acadmies scholars making crafts

a.span: PLA Detroit Charter Schools to Continue in Excellence

div.p: PLA is working with both Central Michigan University (CMU) and the MECC Board to have CMU as their new charter authorizer for Stewart, Trix, and Murphy Academies in Detroit.

a.title: Go to comments for PLA Detroit Charter Schools to Continue in Excellence

a.aria-label: PLA Founder & CEO Calls for Government Action to Help Schools Implement Online Learning During Closures in CNN Feature Image

img.alt: PLA Founder & CEO Calls for Government Action to Help Schools Implement Online Learning During Closures in CNN Feature

a.span: PLA Founder & CEO Calls for Government Action to Help Schools Implement Online Learning During Closures in CNN Feature

p.span: He [Phalen] told CNN that he has been scrambling to secure 6,500 devices for his students, many of whom do not own a laptop or tablet. "I believe that the government should be stepping up to support device access and connectivity for all students, but this is not happening," he said.

a.title: Go to comments for PLA Founder & CEO Calls for Government Action to Help Schools Implement Online Learning During Closures in CNN Feature

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies STEM

a.span: Washington Informer Feature: How Phalen Leadership Academies Closed Achievement Gaps Through Effective Teaching

p.span: Six years ago, Earl Martin Phalen founded what has quickly become the largest African American-run charter school network in the country.

a.title: Go to comments for Washington Informer Feature: How Phalen Leadership Academies Closed Achievement Gaps Through Effective Teaching

a.aria-label: Phalen Leadership Academies Highlighted for Blazing New Trails in "Reinventing America's Schools" Image

img.alt: Phalen Leadership Academies Highlighted for Blazing New Trails in "Reinventing America's Schools"

a.span: Phalen Leadership Academies Highlighted for Blazing New Trails in "Reinventing America's Schools"

p.span: After six months, Phalen told me, Weve got the culture straightened out; now we need to get the academic piece fixed. By the time state testing rolled around, the percentage who passed IREADa third-grade test that has not changed in recent yearshad doubled, from 30 to 61%.

a.title: Go to comments for Phalen Leadership Academies Highlighted for Blazing New Trails in "Reinventing America's Schools"

section.h2: You're online. We're online. Let's connect.

div.p: 2323 N. Illinois St
Indianapolis, IN 46208
Fax:

div.span: The McKinney-Vento Act protects scholars from discrimination based on their lack of a permanent residence. Homeless Scholars are eligible to receive a variety of services including: transportation services, free meals under the school nutrition programs, limited English proficiency class, gifted and talented programs, and special education services based on a scholars eligibility. Homeless Scholars will not be denied enrollment based on lack of proof of residency. Please consult the McKinney-Vento Act Liaison if you need assistance. The PLA Network does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability or national origin in any employment and/or educational opportunity. No person shall be excluded from participation in, denied the benefits of, or otherwise subjected to unlawful discrimination in any program or activity for which the PLA Network Board is responsible or for which it receives financial assistance from the U.S. Department of Education. The PLA Network values diversity.
